Sequence Information.Peptide Name: B1CTcu5 (brevinin; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, UCSS1a; 1S=S, XXU)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, the Indian bicoloured frog,Clinotarsus curtipes, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence  is 72.7% similar toB1CTcu1.Activity: Active against B. coagulans ATCC 7050 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml),  Gram- E. coli MG1655 (MIC 7 ug/ml), and V. cholerae (MIC 15 ug/ml). Hemolytic 37.5%. Also inhibit M. tuberculosis at 12.5 ug/ml (Anti-TB) (Abraham et al., 2020). It killed intracellular mycobacteria with no cytotoxicity to human macrophages at the concentrations tested. updated 5/2019; 7/2020
Literature Information.Author: Abraham P, George S, Kumar KS. 2014
Literature Information.Title: Novel antibacterial peptides from the skin secretion of the Indian bicoloured frog Clinotarsus curtipes.
